bug.summary: idist initialize with nccl backend without GPU
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
Call idist.initialize("nccl", ...) without GPU (but pytorch providing nccl) raises an error <denchmark-code>Floating point exception </denchmark-code>
Exception is thrown in barrier following dist.initialize. Case nccl + no GPU should raise an explicit exception. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.5 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): 0.4 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed Ignite (conda, pip, source): conda Python version: 3.7 Any other relevant information:

comments.comment:
Similar code on pure pytorch > CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES="" python -m torch.distributed.launch --use_env --nproc_per_node=1 ddp-no-gpu.py import torch.distributed as dist
if __name__ == '__main__': dist.init_process_group("nccl", init_method="env://") dist.barrier() just say <denchmark-code>subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/opt/conda/bin/python', '-u', 'ddp-no-gpu.py']' died with <Signals.SIGFPE: 8>. </denchmark-code>
Anyway, good catch!
